introduction.title: What Are Cookies?
content: This Cookie Policy explains what cookies are, how we use them on News Portal, and your choices regarding cookies.

Cookies are small text files that are placed on your computer or mobile device when you visit a website. They are widely used to make websites work more efficiently and provide information to website owners.

By continuing to use our website, you consent to our use of cookies in accordance with this Cookie Policy. If you do not agree to our use of cookies, you should change your browser settings or discontinue use of our website.

sections.title: Understanding Cookies
content: Cookies are small data files stored on your browser or device. They help websites remember information about your visit, making your next visit easier and the site more useful to you.

subsections.title: First-Party Cookies
subsections.content: These are cookies set by the website you're visiting. Only that website can read these cookies. We use first-party cookies to provide core website functionality.

subsections.title: Third-Party Cookies
subsections.content: These are cookies set by domains other than the one you're visiting. For example, when you visit our site, analytics providers may set their own cookies to track your behavior across different websites.

subsections.title: Session Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies are temporary and expire when you close your browser. They help us maintain your session as you navigate through our website.

subsections.title: Persistent Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies remain on your device for a set period or until you delete them. They help us remember your preferences and improve your experience on future visits.

sections.title: Why We Use Cookies
content: We use cookies for several important reasons:
items: To enable certain functions of the website and provide core functionality
To provide analytics and track website performance
To store your preferences and settings
To enable social media features and sharing
To deliver relevant advertising and measure ad campaign effectiveness
To understand how visitors interact with our website
To remember you when you return to our website
To improve overall user experience and website performance

sections.title: Types of Cookies We Use
content: We use different types of cookies to run our website and provide you with the best experience. Below is a detailed breakdown:

subsections.title: 1. Strictly Necessary Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies are essential for our website to function properly. They enable basic functions like page navigation, access to secure areas, and form submissions. The website cannot function properly without these cookies.

subsections.title: 2. Performance & Analytics Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies help us understand how visitors interact with our website by collecting and reporting information anonymously. They help us improve the way our website works.
items: Google Analytics - tracks visitor behavior and website performance
Popular content and page view statistics

subsections.title: 3. Functionality Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies enable enhanced functionality and personalization. They may be set by us or by third-party providers whose services we use on our pages.

subsections.title: 4. Targeting & Advertising Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies are used to deliver advertisements more relevant to you and your interests. They are also used to limit the number of times you see an advertisement and measure the effectiveness of advertising campaigns.
items: Social media advertising (Facebook Pixel, Twitter, etc.)

subsections.title: 5. Social Media Cookies
subsections.content: These cookies are set by social media services that we have added to the site to enable you to share our content with your friends and networks.

sections.title: Third-Party Cookies
content: In addition to our own cookies, we also use various third-party services that set cookies on our website. These third parties include:

subsections.title: Google Services
items: Google Analytics - Website analytics and performance tracking
Google Tag Manager - Tag management system

subsections.title: Social Media Platforms
items: Facebook - Social sharing and Facebook Pixel

sections.title: How to Manage Cookies
content: You have the right to decide whether to accept or reject cookies. You can exercise your cookie preferences by managing your settings in several ways:

subsections.title: Cookie Consent Tool
subsections.content: When you first visit our website, we display a cookie banner allowing you to accept or customize your cookie preferences. You can change these preferences at any time by clicking the 'Cookie Settings' link in our website footer.

subsections.title: Browser Settings
subsections.content: Most web browsers allow you to control cookies through their settings. You can set your browser to refuse cookies or delete certain cookies. Please note that if you block cookies, some parts of our website may not function properly.
items: Google Chrome: Settings > Privacy and Security > Cookies
Mozilla Firefox: Options > Privacy & Security > Cookies

subsections.title: Opt-Out Tools
subsections.content: You can opt out of certain third-party cookies using industry opt-out tools:
items: European Interactive Digital Advertising Alliance: youronlinechoices.eu

sections.title: Do Not Track Signals
content: Some browsers have a 'Do Not Track' (DNT) feature that lets you tell websites you do not want to have your online activities tracked.

Currently, there is no industry standard for how companies should respond to DNT signals. At this time, our website does not respond to DNT browser signals, but we will continue to monitor developments in this area.

sections.title: Cookies on Mobile Devices
content: Our website and mobile applications may also use cookies and similar tracking technologies. The same principles apply, but you may need to adjust settings on your mobile device:
items: iOS: Settings > Safari > Block All Cookies or Settings > Privacy > Advertising
Android: Settings > Google > Ads or Chrome > Settings > Site Settings > Cookies
You can reset your advertising ID in your device settings
Some mobile apps may use in-app tracking; check app settings for opt-out options

sections.title: Web Beacons & Pixel Tags
content: In addition to cookies, we may use other technologies such as web beacons (also known as pixel tags or clear GIFs) to track user behavior and measure website performance.
Web beacons are tiny graphics with a unique identifier that work similarly to cookies. Unlike cookies which are stored on your device, web beacons are embedded invisibly on web pages.
items: Track when content is viewed or an email is opened
Measure the effectiveness of email campaigns
Better understand customer behavior and preferences

sections.title: Local Storage & Similar Technologies
content: We may also use local storage technologies like HTML5 local storage and IndexedDB. These technologies allow us to store data locally on your browser and are similar to cookies but can store larger amounts of information.
Local storage is used to improve performance and enhance your experience by storing preferences and application data that doesn't need to be sent to the server with every request.

sections.title: Consequences of Disabling Cookies
content: You can choose to disable cookies, but please note that doing so may affect your experience on our website. If you disable cookies, you may experience:
items: Inability to sign in or access certain features
Loss of personalized settings and preferences
Need to re-enter information on repeat visits
Inability to use social sharing features

sections.title: Updates to Cookie Policy
content: We may update this Cookie Policy from time to time to reflect changes in technology, legislation, our business operations, or for other operational, legal, or regulatory reasons.
When we make changes, we will update the 'Last Updated' date at the top of this policy. We encourage you to review this Cookie Policy periodically to stay informed about how we use cookies.

sections.title: GDPR & ePrivacy Compliance
content: If you are located in the European Economic Area (EEA), we comply with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and the ePrivacy Directive regarding cookies and similar technologies.
items: We obtain your consent before placing non-essential cookies
You have the right to withdraw consent at any time
We provide clear information about what cookies we use and why
You can manage your cookie preferences through our cookie banner
We maintain records of your consent
We ensure third parties comply with applicable privacy laws

sections.title: CCPA Compliance (California)
content: If you are a California resident, you have certain rights under the California Consumer Privacy Act (CCPA) regarding cookies and online tracking:
items: Right to know what personal information is collected via cookies
Right to know if your personal information is sold or shared
Right to opt-out of the sale of personal information
Right to request deletion of personal information collected via cookies
You can exercise these rights through our Privacy Center or by contacting us
